intro: Ainsliaea cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodland floors and stream banks. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. Ainsliaea cordifolia is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
